intro: Lobelia horombensis, commonly known as the Horombé lobelia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Central Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows as an erect herb with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of dense forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
